oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Use of a Buhner Needle to Place Minchev Sutures for Vaginal/Cervical Prolapse Retention
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hoover, Toby R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Minchev technique
prolapse retention
vaginal
cervical
prolapses
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The use of the Minchev technique for prolapse retention is a simple, yet effective means of preventing the reoccurrence of vaginal/cervical prolapses in the bovine species. At least two methods have been proposed to place the retention sutures, but I have used the Modified Buhner needle as a yet-simpler means of placing these button sutures.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1986; 202
